titleStmt.title: To MESSRS CAREY, LEA and BLANCHARD,Carey, Lea and Blanchard, Philadelphia publishers and booksellers; originally Carey and Carey, later Lea and Blanchard (see To Messrs Lea and Blanchard, 13 February 1842). They published all CD’s major books from Sketches by Boz to David Copperfield: see further Pilgrim Letters 1, pp. 322-3nn. The letter concerns payments to CD by the firm and proposals for the transmission of early proofs of future works. 26 OCTOBER 1837

sourceDesc.p: after MS Messrs Lea and Febiger add Address (MS, envelope only, Profiles in History, California, 2004): Messrs Carey and Company / Philadelphia / care of Mr. John Miller.John Miller, bookseller and publisher of 13 Henrietta Street, Covent Garden; Carey, Lea and Blanchard’s London agent until 1861.
